storyInfo: With Das Kaiserinnensfest looming, Sturmland-Kurfürst Werner von Hochberg is assassinated in his own spire. After years estranged, Viviana returns to her hometown and gets to know Cora, an old friend of her parents, yet loses her chance to see her father Werner one last time.

attributes.content: Rain and wind come hand in hand with evening in Kreis Sturmland. After generations of keepers, a house spire's decrepit stairwells will always hide moss somewhere in their cracks, no matter how the casters work to keep them clean.

He thinks of Zwillingstürme. Of the time when the black spire reminiscent of twisted horns had yet to be superseded by the newly erected twin spires, when the majestic city was called by a different name.

Of the dazzling auburn alleys in autumn, the kind he'd cross through in his youth, still sans wand or dagger. Nestled in his hands were but a few bound poetry collections, and precious hopes of freedom.

Not so anymore. Though the storm briefly abates, the spire's peak is still ruinously cold. Moonlight stabs through the drapery like rain, like a nail driven through each and every hope as it springs up.
What a shame, he laments.
Never again will he see the marigold in bloom.
Northern border of Leithanien, in Fels, the capital of Kreis Sturmland, 1100
Marvelous, truly marvelous!
attributes.name: Older Noble

attributes.content: A performance of such fluency, as if the moonlight were caressing my cheeks—Herr Erich, what are your thoughts?
attributes.name: Older Noble

attributes.content: Martha, why do you treat me so?
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Why speak of her? It's not as if your ex-fiancée were here, Herr Erich.
attributes.name: Older Noble

attributes.content: The callousness in your features stings my heart deep, yet your beauty takes my breath away all the same. Such that I cannot forget—
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: I strongly suggest you move your hands away from my waist. People are watching.
attributes.name: Older Noble

attributes.content: A-Apologies! Did the piece end already? I hadn't even realized.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: I don't know why, but just now it was as if I'd been transported back to last autumn. To the day my Martha left me. The sorrow crushed my chest.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: As I always say, take more walks. Concerts like this may well be rare in Sturmland, but Zwillingstürme is a different story.
attributes.name: Older Noble

attributes.content: *sigh* Sadly, I may not make it to Das Kaiserinnensfest this year.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: As I recall, meine Herr, you've a distant uncle with a seat at the Kurfürstenhof. Could it be you've heard something? I know that Kurfürst Werner—
attributes.name: Older Noble

attributes.content: No, nothing reliable at least.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: But the Kurfürst has hardly left his spire once these past months. Even the doctor rarely attends him anymore, while visits from casters serving other houses have only grown more frequent.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: It would seem almost none of us will be venturing outside of Sturmland these days. Das Kaiserinnensfest may come every year, but an audience with the new Lehnsherr? Who would dare miss that?
attributes.name: Older Noble

attributes.content: I wouldn't dream of it. No offense, but I'd prefer to spend my dreams with my lovely Martha instead.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Thank goodness we have Frau Arturia Giallo.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Only her cello can grant me a brief reprieve from the pressures of the day. A welcome breath of fresh air.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Quite right. A pity that today will be her final concert here.
attributes.name: Older Noble

attributes.content: Then let me be drunk on it for a while more, just a while. After all, the storm is nigh again.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: What are you standing around for?
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: Did the steward not explain your duties? You're to return to the cellar immediately once dinner is served. Don't disturb the Kurfürst while he's resting.
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: The stern chastisement falls on deaf ears.
The servant walks off in a stupor. Down the steps and through the door, like a shell stripped of her soul, she ambles toward the cracking thunder outside.
Hold it.
attributes.name: Spire Caster
Spire Caster
attributes.content: Is that...

attributes.name: Spire Caster
attributes.content: blood on your hands?
Is the Kurfürst...
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: Guards, quickly!
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: *sigh* When will this weather make up its mind? If this keeps up, my firewood'll be damp again, and I just put it away.
attributes.name: Grocer

attributes.content: Henk, could you start the fire already?! How long could it possibly take when the back garden is right there? Did you forget your wand again—
attributes.name: Grocer

attributes.content: ...May I have an extra candle, sir?
Of course, Frau Droste. Will you be waiting here for someone again, like yesterday?
attributes.name: Grocer

attributes.content: Ja.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The wind's especially strong tonight. You might want to go upstairs; it'll be warmer in there.
attributes.name: Grocer

attributes.content: It's fine. I haven't been back in so long, but... my body's still accustomed to the weather here.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Hahah, I just about forgot you're from Sturmland yourself.
attributes.name: Grocer

attributes.content: I saw an article about you in the paper a few years back, and I must say it caught me off guard. And here I thought I would recognize every young'un raised in these parts.
attributes.name: Grocer

attributes.content: It's not surprising you don't remember me. I'm just an ordinary person. I always have been.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Careful now, modesty kills.
attributes.name: Grocer

attributes.content: I even thought the article might've been poppycock until you strolled through the door of my shop. You have the poise and grace of a blueblood from up in the spires.
attributes.name: Grocer

attributes.content: I appreciate what you've done for me over the last two days, Herr Müller. Especially...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Don't you worry now, I won't tell a soul you're here. I know the media's been hounding you even after your retirement.
attributes.name: Grocer

attributes.content: Look on the bright side. You're in Leithanien again: they only ever headline nobles and their big affairs.
attributes.name: Grocer

attributes.content: ...I suppose.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But look at me, keeping you to myself again. Here's your candle. What else will you be needing?
attributes.name: Grocer

attributes.content: Might you... have any more books you could lend me?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You got through that novel already? I'll check the cupboard, anything you'd like to read next? I've got... two illustrated guides, a historical fiction, and five or so poetry anthologies.
attributes.name: Grocer

attributes.content: I'm thinking you'd prefer the poems? Kurfürst Werner runs this folk poetry society, and all these poets like to turn up as special guests. Or so I hear.
attributes.name: Grocer

attributes.content: No, I'll have the historical fiction, please.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: After returning, I don't think I could stand any more poetry for a while.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Righty-o. Take this one, then, and don't worry about returning it anytime soon. I'll leave you be now.
attributes.name: Grocer

attributes.content: Henk, Henk—you little Lausbub, I know you're lazing about somewhere!
attributes.name: Grocer

attributes.content: ...Die Glut. Embers...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It's an interesting tale. Though... it doesn't bear much resemblance to actual history.
Ah, I didn't notice there were other customers. Guten Abend.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It certainly is a good evening.
May I ask your name...?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Cora. Cora Löwenstein.
So I take it you've read this novel, Frau Löwenstein?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Regretfully, I've only been to the opera adapted from it. By the time it was published, I'd lost my ability to enjoy literature.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Ah, your eyes... I apologize. That was tactless of me.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Oh, you get used to it after twenty or so years. Besides, it saves money on candles and firewood on nights like these. Do you mind if I sit a little nearer?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: By all means.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: What warm candleflame.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Did it start raining out there? Your clothes are damp.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I forgot to take my umbrella, what with the rush I was in.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Pardon me if I'm mistaken, but did you come here to meet me?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: All these years, and business here is still sluggish.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Or no, I suppose... everything in Sturmland is the same as ever. We're far from the capital, Catastrophes keep coming, and the weather here lives up to its name. Outside of special occasions, we hardly ever see many out-of-towners.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I still remember the view from this spot by the window. You can see the nomadic plate with the Kurfürst's parlor spire, can't you? He should've picked somewhere more out of the way for you.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: So it was him who sent you...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Hold my hand. Tight.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Listen closely.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I hear people... many of them, hiding outside in the gales.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You can control the candleflame by your hand, right Viviana?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I can.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Then on my mark, please—
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Let's 'extinguish.'
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The instant the candlelight dims, the grocer's windows shatter into pieces.
The rainstorm outside pours in alongside assorted Arts energy covering a full spectrum of effects.
Viviana grips Cora's hand, struck with the sense that she's sitting on a skiff in the heart of a raging sea.
Wave after wave of Arts crash down on them, all but blowing the humble storefront to smithereens, yet precisely parting to leave the two of them unscathed.
Footsteps clack within the shop.
They can't tell where we are; they have to approach to feel us out. Can you sense their positions?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: ...Crystal clear. Let me handle this.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Candleflame leaps anew from Viviana's palm.
The shadows come to life, reaching their limbs through the ruins and spreading across the rubble to pin the looming casters in place.
...Seven, eight.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Nine.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: We're safe for now.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You saved my life.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You handled the brunt of it. All I did was 'tune' their Arts a little.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Now, let's get away from here before more assassins come calling.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Who were they?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: People here to meet you, like me.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Will Herr Müller and Henk be in danger?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Our old gentleman's in the back garden—he avoided this attack. My colleague will get him to safety shortly.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: As for Herr Assistent... he's the one who called them. He should've known that dealing in shady business like this would earn him more than a handful of Originium ingots.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I... honestly don't see how I'm any sort of worthwhile target.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I'll explain in a moment. For the time being, Viviana...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Could you let me take a proper 'look' at you?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You mean...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The woman's beautiful face may be unfamiliar to her, but her voice and expression are anything but. Viviana finds herself unable to decline.

Cora lifts her hands, and feels about for Viviana's cheeks, her fingers tracing a few soft strokes once they alight. Her movements are infinitely tender, the sort one would use for handling the most precious instrument.
And as if in response, tears well up in her lusterless eyes.
You resemble your mother so much.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: If only Werner could see you now, how joyous he would've been. So close, too... He spent so long struggling in his sickbed, just to see you one last time.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Werner... My father?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Did he...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I'm so sorry, Viviana.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Not long ago, your father... Sturmland-Kurfürst Werner... passed away in his spire.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: And that was how it transpired, meine Herr. We were all in our places keeping watch. Nobody expected the assassin to infiltrate the Kurfürst's room.
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: The assassin. You mean to say, the Kurfürst's personal attendant?
Ja, meine Herr.
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: She had been employed in this spire for more than half her life.
The Kurfürst trusted her implicitly, as did we all. Yet without a doubt, she was the last to see him alive.
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: Did anyone else enter the room after the incident?
Only the personal bodyguard and the doctor.
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: Did anyone at all step outside?
Nein, not one of us set foot outside the parlor spire this evening.
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: We still haven't identified who among us is to blame, so we've locked all the servants in the basement cells for now. Shall I show you the way?
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: No need. I've already met with them.
Did you question the assassin?
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: Having been under the effects of psychological Arts, she has no recollection of her whereabouts.
We should try torturing her. Otherwise, it's near-impossible to determine if she's lying.
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: Well then. Are you lying?
Me? Nein, meine Herr, how could I? I've been loyal to the Hochberg family for over a decade! Everything I have I owe to Kurfürst Werner!
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: Then... would you swear that upon the Güldenesgesatz?
Güldenesgesatz... The Golden Movement...
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: H-How would I dare deceive a Gesatzswächter!
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: You left the spire after what happened in there.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: You have the smell of rainwater on you. The hem of your clothes has brushed against the moss in the cracks of the steps outside.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Ten years is nothing. You don't yet know House Hochberg's spire well enough, just as you didn't know Kurfürst Werner well enough.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: The Kurfürst... He summoned you here...
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: The Kurfürst picked up on your disloyalty. You began stirring into action once he fell ill.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: I only regret that Frau Löwenstein and I were ultimately one step behind.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Send notice to the Concertmaster that the Gesatzswächter's found that—
attributes.name: 'Spire Caster'

attributes.content: Earrgh—!
attributes.name: 'Spire Caster'

attributes.content: It is futile to resist the melody's fetters. Much like your wisdom, your Arts are ugly and brittle.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Where did you send that thing?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Gakhakha—ggh!
attributes.name: 'Spire Caster'

attributes.content: Answer me, remnant.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Z... Zwillingstü...
attributes.name: 'Spire Caster'

attributes.content: Is your 'Concertmaster' the one who used psychological Arts to influence the attendant? Are they also in Zwillingstürme?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: The Concert... master...
attributes.name: 'Spire Caster'

attributes.content: No, my head... MY HEAD!
attributes.name: 'Spire Caster'

attributes.content: The Golden Melody now resounds in the deepest parts of your soul.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Any intent to disobey, and your mind will collapse beneath its weight.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Gesatzswächter...
attributes.name: 'Spire Caster'

attributes.content: With such absolute power, why must you serve as a thrall to the Twin Puppets?!
attributes.name: 'Spire Caster'

attributes.content: It is not my melody that restrains you, nor the decree of the Kaiserinnen.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: What you are failing to resist is the will of Leithanien herself.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: The will of... Leithanien?
attributes.name: 'Spire Caster'

attributes.content: Hah... hahah! Since when did the present-day Leithanien... have even a fraction of the will she should?
attributes.name: 'Spire Caster'

attributes.content: The Genesis Horn... The might of the great Herkunftshorn will come to enshroud this land anew!
attributes.name: 'Spire Caster'

attributes.content: GKHAAAAAAAAGHH!
attributes.name: 'Spire Caster'

attributes.content: The feeble sound that death plays. A caster that can seize such cries over such a long distance is no ordinary remnant.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: ...The Concertmaster.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Frau, the ride for Zwillingstürme is here. Are we leaving right now?
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Yes. Let's go.
The friend who invited me here has just taken the curtain call. I've played every piece I needed to.
There's no reason to linger here any longer.
Somehow, without realizing... I'd been staying here all this time...
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Martha, my dear Martha... Oh, it's like I'm dreaming. How long would I have to wait to hear such a remarkable performance again?
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: I've told you people, you are not to disturb me whenever I'm attending a con—
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: What? Wait, what did you say?
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: I'll be back posthaste. Get my ride ready. I need to see a few friends.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: And one more thing—I want the wood carving I bought in Kreis Lupukarn, as well as the Victorian porcelain I keep in the study. Bring them both.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Why such haste? Was the Kurfürst not alive and well this morning?
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: The days to come will be arduous once more. Oh, Arturia... Only your music and your beauty can deliver me from this nightmare.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: The sheer effort I went to just to arrive at her interim abode, only to find she'd already...
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Please continue.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: C-Continue? Who are you? And what's that you're holding? A wand or a—
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: You mentioned an intent to visit Arturia. I assume you have some relation to her.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I am currently searching for her. Therefore, I require any and all pertinent leads.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You're looking for Frau Giallo too? Are you some fanatic follower of hers?
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Follower? That is a highly inaccurate description.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Per the tenets of the law, and on special assignment by the Curia, I must apprehend the fugitive and repatriate her to Laterano.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: F-Fugitive? Frau Giallo is a guest of the Kurfürst, and no matter the rumors from outside... No, I find you far more suspicious!
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Herr Erich! Are you still well?
attributes.name: Older Noble

attributes.content: They put the alley under lockdown out there; Gendarmerie all over. I hear even a Gesatzswächter went over to the Kurfürst's parlor spire.
attributes.name: Older Noble

attributes.content: Danke, I'm well enough. I was just about to visit a few Grafen and see what word I could pick off the grapevine. *sigh* How uncanny can one night get? Damn my indolent chauffeur—where is he?!
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: At least one small stroke of fortune is that Frau Giallo has already safely departed for Zwillingstürme.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Wait, where did that eerie Sankta get off to?
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: ...The fugitive Arturia is no longer here.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Executor Federico, continuing pursuit of target.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Destination: Zwillingstürme, capital of Leithanien.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It's time we got going too, Viviana.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: They'll announce that the Kurfürst passed from illness. It's understandable. A white lie to keep the domain in order.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I won't be able to attend the funeral, will I?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I'm so sorry. You never even got to see him one last time after you rushed back from Kazimierz and everything. And now you can't even go to...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: ...Mourn him.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I'm not even sure I have the right to anyway.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I scarcely remember how he looked. In all these years, all the word 'father' meant to me was just the letters he sent to Kazimierz.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: And yet I can't help but think that even the letters themselves might well have been written by a retainer in his stead.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Your father never once forgot about you.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Mm... So everyone tells me, including himself.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: And I'm willing to believe it.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But as I read that last letter, I still hesitated. I didn't know if I should... No, if I wanted to come back.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You have a tender heart, Viviana. I can't imagine you'd ever decline a dying man's last wish.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Or perhaps... it was the spire I wanted to see one last time.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Just to see if it still towered over the clouds, like I remembered.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You can't go back there. At least, not for now.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: For your own safety, we shouldn't remain in Sturmland for long.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Were the ones who took his life and the casters who came for me last night... sent by the same people?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Not necessarily. With Werner gone, anyone that knows who you are has reason enough to make a move against you.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You're your father's sole descendant. In times this turbulent, neither his enemies, nor his former vassals, nor anyone else potentially in line to succeed him will just leave you be.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Then what about you? Why are you protecting me?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Think, and you might still recall, child. Thirteen years ago, upon your mother's passing, I was the one who took you to the Grand Knight Territory.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Then you're... the Imperial Orchestra of Leithanien's...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Instrument tuner. Quite a convenient role.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The Reichsorchester's visit symbolized the friendly ties between Leithanien and Kazimierz. No one would think to question a child with an instrument among them.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: So you've saved my life... more than once.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It was your father who wanted to, more than anyone.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Some months ago, Werner realized his days were waning, and he worried that after he left us, you'd be dragged down as a sacrifice in the power struggle.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Your role in this is unique. Whether you chose to return to Leithanien or stay in Kazimierz, the waves would have reached you regardless.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: He had no choice but to turn to me and Brandt. He hoped that as old friends of his, we could bring you safely to Zwillingstürme.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: There, you'll be under the protection of the Kaiserinnen.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Protection... of the Empresses?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Ja. That's what Werner wanted for you.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Viviana von Hochberg—
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: In the name of your family, you are to serve as an Empresses' Voice.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Central Leithanien, Kreis Einwald, in a town on the outskirts of Zwillingstürme, not far from the city gate
*huff*... *pant*... I need sleep. Verdammt! Why am I on duty again?
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: Those spry young wretches, always clocking out early. What excuse did they have today, a new movie? Some underground live show?
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: The moment the month rolls over, I'll see that I get a word in with the Baron, to speed up my transfer to Zwillingstürme...
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: Hey, you there!
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: What are you doing, loitering here this late?
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: I am taking my regular walk.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: To my knowledge, there have been no new decrees forbidding law-abiding citizens like myself from rambling the wilds past midnight.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: ...Well, you're not wrong.
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: Just another bored youth going for a walk. Why was I getting so nervous?
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: ...Am I free to go now? I appreciate your concern.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Go on, be on your— Wait.
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: Why do I get the feeling... I've seen you somewhere before?
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: You could be mistaken. After all, you did just tell me that strolling nighttime youths are as common as anything.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Where are you from? By your accent, I'm guessing the Urtica Grafschaft?
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: I was born there... in the countryside.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Countryside? What kind of country bumpkin talks like that? Stop being ridiculous.
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: No... Now that you mention it, I've never heard any commoner pronounce things the way you do. Say, you wouldn't happen to be the runaway son of some small-time noble, would you?
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: Let me check your ID.
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: If you're fantasizing about gaining the favor of some aristocrat for returning me, then you will be sorely disappointed.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: ...Has anyone ever told you that the way you talk could seriously piss people off?
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: ID. Now.
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: Pardon, pardon, I've got my boy's passport right here. Do peruse.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: And who are you?
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: Come on, you don't remember me? I live in the city. That second-hand bookshop guy.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Speaking of which, the books aren't quite flying off the shelves, and lately I've been thinking, what about a cafe instead? You must be awfully tired this late on patrol, no? Here, here, try my coffee. My own brew.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: *choke*... Mein Gott, the taste... I'd forget about that cafe if I were you, for your own sake.
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: Haha, as long as it wakes you up. So are you done with the passport?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: ...Ebenholz. That's your full name?
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: Ja.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: His parents just love the piano. The keys, especially—it was between Ebenholz or Elfenbein.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Well, whatever, be on your way. You think they pay me enough to question a kid's legal name? And yes, give me all the disgusting swill you've got left, I'll need it.
attributes.name: Tired Security Guard

attributes.content: If you'd known you'd be back so soon, would you have not burned your passport?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: I regret nothing.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: If you must know, I naturally assumed that whenever you people wanted me back, you'd simply print a second one. Or as many as you need.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: ...So why did you come back?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: For the hundreds of thousands of residents of the Urtica Grafschaft. Over a hundred retainers in the spire alone. I'm not so far gone in my selfishness that I'd sacrifice them all for my so-called freedom.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Which means you can stop it with the jokes, my dear spy. Or did Their Majesties send you to try me again? See if maybe I'll pour my heart out and wait on them hand and foot?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: With Das Kaiserinnensfest approaching, Zwillingstürme has been restless lately.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Heh... And of course I still have that thing in my head.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I know better than any of you that the performance of this ludicrously grating piece is far from over.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Listen to me, meine Herr. My mission ends here.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Once you head into Zwillingstürme, someone else will pick you up.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Maybe you've already realized this, but you had two correspondence. One ordering you to come to the capital, and the other granting you your official 'death.' But it wasn't the same Majesty that wrote both.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Compared to the first's benevolence, the other...
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Ebenholz doesn't even let Biegler finish before walking off.
Just before disappearing around the corner for good, the young man waves ta-ta to him.
So you knew.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Former Graf Urtica, are you hoping for... a true death this time?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: *huff*... I'm getting sentimental now, in all this miserable gray weather.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: May you...
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: No, never mind.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: If people like us still have a shred of luck to spare—
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: —Then let's pray we never have to meet again.
attributes.name: Biegler
